data.scheme_name: Scheme for Creation of Infrastructure for Agro Processing Cluster (APC) - Basic enabling Infrastructure - General, OBC - Except NER and Hill States - Except SHG, Others - Existing
data.benefits: The Scheme provides grants-in-aid @ 35% of eligible project cost , subject to max. of Rs. 1000 lakh  per project for basic enabling infrastructure
data.eligibility: All existing food processing units setting up Agro Processing Cluster Projects are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. The total value of the applicant’s assets (net worth) must be at least 1.5 times the amount of money they are applying for as a grant. 
  2. The applicant must get a bank loan of at least 20% of the total project cost. 
  3. The applicant must contribute at least 20% of the total project cost from their own funds (equity). 
  4. The entities applying for financial assistance are required to submit a non-refundable fee of Rs. 0.20 lakh. Expansion/ upgradation of existing facility(ies) is not eligible.
data.beneficiaries: All existing food processing units setting up Agro Processing Cluster Projects are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The total value of the applicant’s assets (net worth) must be at least 1.5 times the amount of money they are applying for as a grant. 
  2. The applicant must get a bank loan of at least 20% of the total project cost. 
  3. The applicant must contribute at least 20% of the total project cost from their own funds (equity). 
  4. The entities applying for financial assistance are required to submit a non-refundable fee of Rs. 0.20 lakh. Expansion/ upgradation of existing facility(ies) is not eligible.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to create modern infrastructure for food processing closer to production areas.
data.objective: To provide integrated and complete preservation infrastructure facilities from farm gate to the consumer.
data.description:
1. The Scheme provides grants-in-aid @ 35% of eligible project cost , subject to max. of Rs. 1000 lakh per project for basic enabling infrastructure. 
  2. The grants-in-aid is credit linked but not back-ended.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link : https://sampada-mofpi.gov.in/Login.aspx
data.funding_mechanism:
1. First Installment (35% of the grant) : Given after spending 35% of the bank loan and 35% of the own money (equity). 
  2. Second Installment (40% of the grant) : Given after spending 75% of the bank loan and 75% of the own money (equity). 
  3. Third Installment (15% of the grant) : Given when the project is 90% complete and required documents are submitted. 
  4. Final Installment (10% of the grant) : Given when the project is fully completed and required documents are submitted.
data.faq:
Q.) Who are eligible for this scheme?
Ans. Any entrepreneur planning to setup food processing industry is eligible for the scheme
Q.) What is the monitory assistance provided by government under the scheme?
Ans. The government provides a grant-in-aid (Upto 10 crore per project) of 35% of the eligible project cost in general areas and 50% of the eligible project cost in the North East region, ITDP areas and UTs of India. Q.) What are different categories under which entrepreneurs can setup the processing unit ?
Ans. The different categories under which entrepreneurs can setup processing units include fruits & vegetables, meat, milk, RTE/RTC foods, grains, mushrooms, spices, food flavours, additives, etc.
data.additional_info: Basic enabling infrastructure: Includes site development, development of industrial plots, boundary wall, roads, drainage, water supply, electricity supply including power backup, effluent treatment plant, parking bay, weigh bridges, common office space etc.
data.checklist_info_a:
1) Udyam Registration Certificate 
 2)Detailed Project Report (DPR)  
3)CA/Statutory Auditor Certificate  
4)Detailed Appraisal Note from Scheduled Commercial Bank  
5)Certificate of Incorporation  
6)Memorandum of Association  
7)PAN,TAN,SC/ST Certificate  
8)Proof of submission of Requisite fee   
9)Correspondances(email/letter)  
10)Annual Report  
11)Detail of land
